reviews.review_msg: Claire Bossavit is an amazing prof. She's really nice, speaks clearly and is pretty easy to understand (which matters a lot for a French course conducted in French), and also the course is pretty easy. A lot of the marks are just participation, and the rest is mainly tests which are easy if you've done the online homework. Highly recommend her

Claire takes time to genuinely give feedback on your homework, however participation and paying attention in class will haunt you as she picks on individuals to speak up during lecture. She cares about how students do and provides really helpful insight when asked.

Claire is a good prof and she makes her classes engaging with lots of interaction and interactive activities. You definitely have to go to class and do the online modules before and after class but if you do them and apply her feedback it's not hard to do decently in the course.

I think Professor Bossavit is amazing! Though she may be a little tough with marking at times, her feedback is very helpful and she seems to really care about her students. She is always more than happy to help you if you are confused about a topic. I enjoyed her lectures and she was very forgiving with the grammar tests allowing us 5 chances.
She's a great prof who really wants her students to learn French and helps in any way possible to make sure they succeed.

Had her for 2 classes online, the modules were super clear, easy to follow. I had no idea how good I had it last semester, I didn't have to go searching around for what was due this week, just had to look at the module and it included everything. About her lectures, it's easy to participate, and she's not the most interesting person but was chill.

Claire is a good prof, especially for this course. I took this course as a high school french immersion student and found it similar to what I had previously learned, however it is grammar so it's not super easy. Tests were fair but she is picky when marking write ups (compositions, paragraphs). Grammar sessions are a huge help!! Overall solid!

I have been with Claire for my two French classes and I definitely love her. She is really helpful and is always there for help. She is a tough grader though. But, if you prof read your essays and practice listening, you will be good to go.

Claire is an amazing professor! If you want to learn French, she is the right prof. Each class was extraordinary and informative. She created very interesting assignments and I am sure that Claire spent a lot of time to prepare course materials.
Claire is an amazing person and professor, but she is a tough marker. BRUSH UP ON YOUR ECOUTE BEFORE TAKING A CLASS WITH HER. half an exam is solely ecoute.
Claire is a caring, kind teacher who is there for her students..
Very clear teaching style, very nice instructor. Would recommend!

Came from highschool, was in for a shock when I realized her class was ENTIRELY in French! Super nice, very patient - sometimes she has to repeat things multiple times or in different ways for me to understand. Our class is pretty informal - she lets us have fun and be creative. Quizzes - straightforward and boost mark. Exams are manageable.
Good prof, a little bit dull at times, but a nice lady nonetheless. She teaches her material very clearly, and is always ready to clarify and make corrections. Solid course!
Easy, friendly, helpful... what's not to like?  Enjoyed the class very much.
Blah. That is all I have to say. She is the most unhelpful person EVER. Does not seem to give crap about her students.
Ya... don't take a class with her. She's dismissive; you ask her a question and she'll tell you, "Did you read the book? Because if you did, you'd understand it."

She's ok. I didn't find her to be terribly warm or gregarious - something I think is needed in a conversationally based class to kick things off. I missed having a cultural context to the class and the main book is expensive & useless, her WebCT notes are better at explaining concepts. Her tests, marking, etc are extremely fair no complaints there.
She is a great teacher. She is sooooo beautiful. I fell in love with her eyes:)
she's alright, she seems to know what she's talking about, you just need the will, you have to want to get a decent grade and apply yourself
An excellent prof. Well organized, fair marker, very approachable. The material is not easy, but if you did well in 211, you shouldn't have any problems.
super easy tests and material. preps you well for them. she'll also mark ur comp twice and give u a higher mark. nice prof
Not an enthusiastic teacher at all. Her tests are fair game because she makes sure she covers everything we need to know. Class is pretty easy just make sure you keep up with it.

horribly boring course material, and a horribly boring person animating it!  she was monotonous and most kids either skipped or fell asleep.  for those that worked their butts off, they were rewarded with ridiculously low marks on compositions and assignments.  she never has words of encouragement, and she speaks to you if you are a retard.
